div.p: [ENGLISH from FRENCH] Forms of various protractions, which are commonly called Moresques, or laurel leaves, made in the manner of Persians, Assyrians, Arabs, Egyptions, Indians, Turks, & Greeks, amply arrayed to the great good of painters, goldsmiths, sculptors, glassworkers, tappisers, embroiderers, & all others who work with needles.
